response:
Hi,

From my position as aspiring GreenOps engineer I want to share my view on
the ownership issue your raise.

I agree that the responsibility is split over various levels as you already
synthesized, and I don't think that will change significantly. What I do
think is that we need to increase and improve communication between all
stakeholders to realise a better workflow for actual implementers.
Currently I feel like this fragmentation is a major blocker for actual
implementation as there are various ways to tackle sustainability. This is
of course due to the nature of a company or organisations business and way
of working but generalised standards and tools could really help in this
regard.

For me personally I think some kind of mindset change is required for
management to make sustainability among the highest priorities of the
organisation. For me this is already logical as an unsustainable company
has an inherent path to failure. However current sentiment seems to be
focused mainly on finance. This should be incentivised by law. If the
mindset is like that than this opens many possibilities to actual
sustainable improvements which in the end will actually improve the
footprint and also the finances.

I think initially dedicated teams within organisations are required to
kickstart the sustainability efforts. This team can gather and spread
information and workflows to help others outside the team understand the
potential impacts. Once the initial improvements have been successfully
implemented and verified these can be used as examples to include the rest
of the organisation in these workflows and create a culture where
sustainability is part of the core culture within the company from the
start of any project and improving legacy. Eventually this would lead to a
deprecation of this team as its not required anymore as the culture is
present company wide.


Lastly, an open framework for a standardized way to measure and report the
sustainability is a key part in my opinion for broad adaptation of these
practices.



Met vriendelijke groet, / Kind regards,


Rover van der Noort

DevOps Engineer


Keyserswey 79, 2201 CX Noordwijk (NL)
